title: Patrice Bergeron becomes new father – still playing tonight - Bruins
text:
Bruins star center Patrice Bergeron and his wife, Stephanie, welcomed a new baby boy, Zack, Wednesday morning, according to the team.
However, “Bergy” will still take the ice Wednesday night against the Philadelphia Flyers, Bruins President Cam Neely said on 98.5 The Sports Hub’s Felger & Massarotti radio show.
Patrice Bergeron will be playing tonight, per Cam Neely on 98.5 The Sports Hub. Bergy became a new father this morning, welcoming son Zack
— Boston Bruins (@NHLBruins) October 21, 2015 As fans learned during the 2013 Stanley Cup Finals, it’s hard to keep No. 37 off the ice. He played Game 6 with a broken rib, torn cartilage and muscles, and a separated shoulder, The Boston Globe reported .
Now, here’s hoping the Bruins have a high enough pick to select Zack Bergeron, most likely a two-way center, in the 2034 draft.
